Title: Next-Level Gaming Experience - PlayStation 5 Console Takes Gaming to New Heights
Body: The PlayStation 5 Console is a true marvel of gaming technology, delivering an unparalleled gaming experience that pushes boundaries and immerses you in a world of stunning visuals, lightning-fast loading times, and innovative features. With its powerful hardware, immersive gameplay, and an incredible library of games, the PlayStation 5 takes gaming to new heights.The standout feature of the PlayStation 5 Console is its cutting-edge hardware, designed to deliver stunning graphics and smooth performance. Powered by a custom AMD Zen 2 processor and a powerful GPU, the console supports ray tracing technology, 4K resolution, and up to 120 frames per second, ensuring breathtaking visuals and incredibly immersive gameplay.The lightning-fast SSD storage in the PlayStation 5 revolutionizes loading times in gaming. Games load in a matter of seconds, reducing wait times and keeping you in the action without interruptions. The console's fast data transfer speeds also enhance game performance, allowing for larger and more detailed game worlds that seamlessly load and render.The DualSense wireless controller is a game-changer in itself. It introduces haptic feedback and adaptive triggers, offering a new level of immersion and realism. Feel the tension of a bowstring or the texture of different surfaces through the controller, enhancing your gameplay experience and making every action feel more impactful and engaging.The PlayStation 5 boasts an impressive library of games, ranging from highly anticipated exclusives to beloved multi-platform titles. From immersive storytelling adventures to pulse-pounding action games, the console offers a diverse range of gaming experiences for every player. With backward compatibility, you can also enjoy select PlayStation 4 games on the PlayStation 5, ensuring a vast library of entertainment right at your fingertips.The console's user interface is intuitive and user-friendly, making it easy to navigate through games, apps, and settings. The redesigned home screen provides quick access to your games, media, and friends, allowing for seamless multitasking and social interactions. The PlayStation Store offers a vast collection of digital games, downloadable content, and multimedia apps, ensuring there's always something to explore and enjoy.The PlayStation Plus subscription service enhances your gaming experience with a variety of benefits. With PlayStation Plus, you gain access to monthly free games, exclusive discounts, online multiplayer, and cloud storage for game saves. This subscription service adds incredible value to your PlayStation 5 experience, ensuring a constant stream of exciting content and multiplayer opportunities.The PlayStation 5 supports a range of multimedia applications, allowing you to enjoy your favorite streaming services, such as Netflix, Disney+, and Spotify, directly on your console. With the ability to stream 4K content, the PlayStation 5 becomes a hub for all your entertainment needs, delivering immersive visuals and high-quality audio for a truly cinematic experience.In conclusion, the PlayStation 5 Console is a powerhouse gaming system that offers an unparalleled gaming experience. With its cutting-edge hardware, lightning-fast loading times, immersive gameplay, and an incredible library of games, the console sets a new standard for gaming excellence. Whether you're a casual gamer or a devoted enthusiast, the PlayStation 5 takes gaming to new heights, providing hours of entertainment, breathtaking visuals, and innovative features that will leave you in awe. Strap in, grab your controller, and get ready for an unforgettable gaming journey with the PlayStation 5.

Title: Terrible Repair/Replacement Process
Body: After 2 years and a few months of having the PS5, I ran into an issue where the entire console shut down after about 30 minutes to an hour of having it on. This happened even after a long cooldown period, and then waiting a few days and trying an entirely new power cord. I did not damage the console in any way prior to this happening. I contacted Sony to get a repair/replacement and of course it's just out of warranty, so I paid the out-of-warranty fee of $250 since gaming is my main hobby and I wanted to get it fixed as soon as possible. I went through the return process online and got through the payment part then received no additional information. I called support right after to address this and was told 2 times that I had to wait for a box, and that it could take 7-10 business days. 10 business days later, I still had no update and no box. I called again and was told that no box was ever shipped to me, but it was going to be shipped out now. 8 business days later from call #2, and I have received no update and no box. I tried to email a support inbox twice about the issue, but I received no word back as I'm not sure the email address is even functional. They make it extremely difficult to get in touch with the company in any capacity and have pre-determined scripts it appears for any complaints, or try to pass it off to automated responses. It has now been almost an entire month with no update, no meaningful communication, and no box. This process is absolutely insane to me having already spent $250 upfront. There's no reason I should be expecting this from a multibillion dollar company. Atrocious return process so far, and potentially the worst customer service experience I have ever had.

Title: The review is about both the seller and the product.
Body: Everything shipped and arrived in the original box with a gash down the side of the box. Nothing wrong with the unit that I could see. No scratches or marks. The cables look like they might have been hooked up once. Just to see if it works. Everything was repackaged back exactly like new, even the cables were wound up in a way that looked like it was never used. Maybe it wasnt. In any case, everything was like new. Turned on and worked like it should. Data transfers are a pain unless you use the cloud storage from playstation plus. Then its easy. Rather than download all your ps4 games all over again, its better to transfer to an external usb drive then transfer from the drive to the console storage or keep it on your usb. Small games dont need to be on the ps5's SSD. Games like fallout 76 however, even though its a ps4 game, when loaded onto the SSD, makes load times dependent on your internet speed and not your systems resources. Fallout 76 is always loading. Everytime you teleport or exit an area. Not on PS5. Not all games will show this kind of increase in speed as some games have loading screens built in on a timer. Only ps4 games though and only a small handful of them cant use the SSD to its full potential but it doesnt matter. The cpu and graphics power reduces load time on its own as well. The storage space of the unit though, is small. Its not even 1 terrabyte so keep that in mind. You will have to run a lot of games off of a usb external drive. What you do , is keep about 150 gigs free on the storage unit at all times. When you get a new game that is load intensive like cyperpunk or red dead or fallout, install it onto the storage unit but when you are done with it , transfer the data back to the usb external. Only use your SSD to store games from PS5 or PS4 games that spend half its time on loading screens like fallout 76. Other than that, the new cpus and graphics power will reduce load times enough for the older games that you wont care about the fact its not on the SSD. Also, the communication speed across the usb cable is drastically increased. USB 3.0 makes a huge difference in load times off the external drive too. So this unit is cool so far. There are some changes made to the OS that most of you PS4 users wont like. No way to turn off sound to the OS. Closing games and apps requires getting used too and it takes more time and effort than it did before. You have to memorize new menu wordings and settings have been moved around. WHICH EVERYONE FINDS ANNOYING AND POINTLESS. If you like playing with headphones you will notice that the output for the volume on the HDMI is lower than you remember. Volume you cant ADJUST. So if you run an HDMI into a TV then use the TVs output into a headphone jack, you will notice the volume is reduced a ton. This forces you to use the headphone jack in the controller, which is beautifully loud and clear and has updated sound drivers that make it noticeably higher quality. But it feels awkward to hold a controller with a cord coming out the bottom. It does give you the ability to walk around freely with no cords to hold you back but id rather my HDMI output be boosted more than it is. When I go to race GT7 online , I have computer audio and PS5 audio ran through a splitter to control my playlist while racing and listening to the engine sounds. With this reduced sound volume through HDMI, i doubt ill be able to even hear my engine sounds while music is playing and there is no way to boost the volume. Cant use the controller port for this solution. The PS5 system software needs a volume control option for the entire OS. Scroll over monopoly plus on the home page and it plays music. I hate that. No way to turn it off. Scrolling through your games shuffles random annoying theme music for every game. No way to turn it off. You need to set your own DNS servers? TOO BAD. Cant really do that anymore without building a completely new connection from the ground up. You cant choose to auto the IP and then manual the DNS. Nope. Everything has to be entered manually. No skipping or auto this and manual that. ALL manual. Or all auto. Thats DUMB and POINTLESS. PS4 game you paid 60$ for? Like GT7? Well if you want the PS5 version they want another 10 dollars. Other games though give you FREE ps5 upgraded versions. Only GT7 and Ghost of Tsushima and Final Fantasy 7 remake (FF7 remake forces you to upgrade to plus EXTRA , its not even about money they want a subscription) force you to pay more. At least, thats all I have in my library that forced me to pay more. So look. This system is not really for dirt poor people. Even if you have a slow internet connection, it will mess with your ability to enjoy this system. Im still waiting on my GT7 ps5 version to finish downloading. ETA? 40 hrs. Thats just one game. If I had my own high speed internet plan though, I could reduce that to about 2 hrs. So be prepared for that. You probably wont be able to play the system the day you buy it. It will take time to transfer your data or download it all over again. The OS sucks and has less features to it than the PS4 did and ive yet to play an actual ps5 game and its been two days. However, just the way it handled fallout 76 made me feel it was worth it. Once you get through all the installation and downloading and updating headaches, and you get used to the more aggravating OS with no themes and backrounds to choose from, and you can solve your audio issues with your custom audio system, I think youll find the system worthy. Its MASSIVE but as quiet as a old 1987 NES. Not a lot of heat either but Id still run a fan on her just because. Im sure the graphics on a ps5 game are beautiful but I wont update my review to tell you about that. You already know the graphics will be great.

Title: My PS5 is the best!
Body: The graphics are absolutely stunning and the gameplay is incredibly smooth. The console is also very fast, with loading times that are significantly shorter than my previous console. The Dual-Sense controller is a major upgrade, with haptic feedback and adaptive triggers that add a new level of immersion to my gaming experience. The user interface is easy to navigate and the console is very sleek and stylish. The customer service team was also very helpful with any questions I had about the product. Overall, I'm extremely satisfied with my purchase and would highly recommend the PlayStation 5 to any gamer in need of a top-quality console.

Do NOT Overpay for the PS5. Amazon is best place if you do choose to go forward, because they are not robbing you with a mark up. However if you have a Pro4, I would wait for the inevitable PS5Pro down the road.

Title: Worth the wait
Body: Worth the wait , bought from Amazon for retail. Amazon has such a better process for buying a ps5 compared to the PS store . If you ask for an invitation to buy a ps5 from amazon and get an invitation in your email , you for sure 100% can order one . It‚Äôs not a free for all like the other method for buying it from the manufacturer for retail . I love that Amazon made the process easy and straightforward. It‚Äôs a great system , our ps4 couldn‚Äôt handle some games and would sound like it was getting ready to take off flying . The ps5 is so smooth and quiet . Doesn‚Äôt overheat . It‚Äôs been fun for sure . Worth the wait . Paying Retail is awesome. I like buying directly from amazon as the seller. It did get dropped off with my bottled water boxes and just left . If you order one be aware it will just be left on your doorstep like it‚Äôs a $12 case of water . Not signing for it surprised me a lot .
